page.title: 18Old Times, Rangeworthy
page.content: {Some local people}have described what the village was like when they were children, that is to say between the 2 World Wars. {They came to school}when they were 4 years old and stayed at the village school until they were 14 when they went out to work. They were often allowed to play in the road because there was not so much traffic. {They can remember going to fairs and {fetes}held in the gardens of the old vicarage and Rangeworthy Court. Steeplechases were held in the fields nearby. {In World War 2,}35 bombs hit Rangeworthy. They were probably dropped by German aircraft after returning from bombing Filton or they may have been from aircraft sent to bomb factories at Yate. {This account is continued on Page 19
